alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 4:43PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT COCONINO COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM MST... At 442 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Stud Horse Point to near Sand Hill Petroglyphs to near Jacob Lake. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Page, Marble Canyon, Jacob Lake, Cliff Dwellers, Marble Canyon Airport, Cathedral Wash Trailhead, Tanner Wash Slot Canyon, Lee`s Ferry, Big Five, Stud Horse Point, Lees Ferry, Horseshoe Bend, and Bitter Springs. This includes the following highways... State Route 98 between mile markers 548 and 549. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 518 and 551. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 524 and 564, between mile markers 568 and 570, and between mile markers 574 and 583. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Black Mesa Area; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
